titles.title: Armored Car Industry Reciprocity Improvement Act of 1996
To amend the Armored Car Industry Reciprocity Act of 1993 to clarify certain requirements and to improve the flow of interstate commerce.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade, and Hazardous Materials.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Commerce. H. Rept. 104-623.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 311.

action.text: Mr. Oxley moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 5/9/1996--Introduced. Armored Car Industry Reciprocity Improvement Act of 1996 - Amends the Armored Car Industry Reciprocity Act of 1993 with respect to State reciprocity of weapons licenses issued to armored car company crew members. Requires crew members: (1) to have met all other applicable requirements to act as an armored car crew member in the State in which such member is primarily employed by such company; and (2) to receive continuing weapons safety and marksmanship training in order to get a weapons license renewed.
